channel.title: Need compiler help
channel.description:
heres what the compiler looks like
@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\java\jdk\bin\javac.exe" -d ./locandclass ./Javafiles/*.java ./Javafiles/sign/*.java pause
ive never seen anything like that, but i was wondering how i get it to work, or change it to the normal ones
and heres the message i get the system cannot be specified....

item.title: Need compiler help

item.description:

it says

press any key to countie…”

item.title: Need compiler help
item.dc:creator: @LearningToCode1 LearningToCode1
item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

[quote=“nazi nigger, post:1, topic:446063”]heres what the compiler looks like

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\java\jdk\bin\javac.exe” -d ./locandclass ./Javafiles/.java ./Javafiles/sign/.java
pause

ive never seen anything like that, but i was wondering how i get it to work, or change it to the normal ones

and heres the message i get
the system cannot be specified…[/quote]Change jdk to your version in my case it’s jdk1.7.0_05 where i put 1.7.0_05 you will put your version there. You can find your version of where you downloaded your jdk to

Read full topic

item.title: Need compiler help
item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

[quote=“Ryan4965, post:2, topic:446063”]Go to:

And whatever folder you see that has “jdk”, copy that name and replace it in your compiler.[/quote]
what he means is like

"C:\Program Files\java\jdk1.7.0_02\bin\javac.exe" -d ./locandclass ./Javafiles/*.java ./Javafiles/sign/*.java
change jdk1.7.0_02 to whatevery it says in ur c:programfiles/java

Read full topic

item.title: Need compiler help
item.dc:creator: @Ryan4965 Ryan4965
item.description:
@Ryan4965 wrote:

Go to:

And whatever folder you see that has “jdk”, copy that name and replace it in your compiler.

Read full topic
